instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message:
The board was liquid damaged around the lcd connector and was replaced and running fine then began to run slow. It pauses at the loading bar for a long while then goes into the OS but lags. The fan does not spin in the OS but spins in diagnostic mode. I have ran diagnostic mode and it passes with no errors. Hwinfo says Airport proximity and Heatpipe outgoing air are both 129c. Also reflowed Smc.
j6050
pin 1 = 5v
pin 2 = 0v
pin 4 =  3.3v

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message:
The fan starts ONLY when CPU gets really hot, as normal behaviour for this board.

Disconnect webcam and check if still low.
If yes, try another tackpad flex/board.

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message: I have tried the webcam cable still the same. I have tried another same model board in the assembly with the same ssd and it runs fine. Hwinfo doesnt have the heatpipe outgoing @129c only the airport proximity.

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message:
Remove RIO board and inspect the top side for corrosion.
Try another RIO flex/board.
Don't forget about trackpad too.

Start in diagnostic mode, for more information.

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message: As mentioned I tried another working board in the same assembly and there were no issues. And as mentioned diagnostic mode did not throw up any errors so it has to be on the board itself.

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message:
Check U5870 area.
Compare diode mode readings with good board.

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message: Nothing found there, I forgot to mention it take a very long time for the loading progress bar  to finish.

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message: Try clean ME BIOS, just in case.

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message: As mentioned earlier, Already tried that and tested with new clean dump.

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message: Just read all post again (2 times); no mention about BIOS found.

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message: Apologies I thought I mentioned I cleaned the Me region and then used a clean dump.

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message: Did you clean it properly, with Medusa?

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message: I dont have a medusa.I used clean Image

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message:
Where did you get the image?
You said cleaned original first and tried another file at the end.

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message: I got the clean image from the forum.

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message:
Try another clean BIOS, just in case.
Upload original BIOS, to clean it.

threads.message:

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message:
Hi laggy performance  and loading bar speed is still the same.

Is there an ASD for this model ?

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message:
No ASD since 2015.
Only an AASP can run AHT.

Replace U5870 and Q5871.
Resolder associated components and check traces continuity.

Did PRAM reset?

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message: Hi yes Pram and smc rests done. Changed those components but still the same very laggy in OS and progress bar. Still getting the "Heatpipe outgoing air 129c"

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message:
The problem should be U5870 related.
Did you check all surrounding resistors and caps?
See what happens removing Q5871.

Check around U5850 too, just in case.

threads.title: 820-4924-a running slow
threads.message:
U5850 is not on this board around the area looks ok. I checked caps and resistors and traces around U5870 no issues. I removed Q5871 and it runs even slower to a crawl.

I swapped the SMC in case it was having an issue but still the same.
